FILE: cm223225v11.0.txt
DYAD: LIECHTENSTEIN-SWITZERLAND
RIVALRY: RIV600
DISPUTE(S): MID3553 

PS: 19900918-20209999 1.00

PS-UPDATE2020:

PSNOTES: Switzerland is responsible for Liechtenstein's defense. The specific MID is probably Swiss army that took a wrong turn into Liechtenstein, as it happened multiple times throughout the years, and it was coded as a MID. Liechtenstein has no military. 

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20220223
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20220223

Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables

MID3553 

TERRMID: MID3553 3 -- not territory 
TERRMID-CER: MID3553 3 -- uncertain 
TERRMID-NOTES: MID3553 from Gibler, Miller, and Little (2016), the Swiss army accidentally crossed into Liechtenstein and later apologized. Liechtenstein did not protest and has no military. Coded uncertain because GML recommend this case be dropped. 

TERRLINK: MID3553 3 -- not third party link to territory 
TERRLINK-CER: MID3553 1 -- certain 
TERRLINK-NOTES: 

MARITMID: MID3553 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID3553 1 -- certain 
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID3553 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID3553 1 -- certain 
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID3553 3 -- not civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID3553 1 -- certain 
CIVWARMID-NOTES:

CIVWARLINK: MID3553 3 -- not civil war link 
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID3553 1 -- certain 
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: 

COUPMID: MID3553 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID3553 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID3553 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID3553 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 

RIVNOTES:

MARITIME-DISPUTE:

Discussion:

SOURCES: Gibler, D. M., S. V. Miller, and E. K. Little. 2016. "An Analysis of the Militarized Interstate Dispute (MID) Dataset, 1816-2001." International Studies Quarterly. 60 (4): 719-730.
